# MTLFunctionConstant

**Class**

A constant that specializes the behavior of a shader.

## Declaration

```swift
class MTLFunctionConstant
```

## Overview

Don’t create an [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLFunctionConstant] instance directly. Instead, the list of function constants for a function by querying the `functionConstants` property of an [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLFunction] instance.

An [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLFunctionConstant] instance should only be obtained from a nonspecialized function created with the [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLLibrary/makeFunction(name:)] method. You only need an [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLFunctionConstant] instance if you don’t have sufficient information to create an [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLFunctionConstantValues] instance used to create a specialized function with the [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLLibrary/makeFunction(name:constantValues:)] or [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLLibrary/makeFunction(name:constantValues:completionHandler:)] method.

## Reading the function constant’s properties

- **name**: The name of the function constant.
- **type**: The data type of the function constant.
- **index**: The index of the function constant.
- **required**: A Boolean value indicating whether the function constant needs to be provided to specialize the function.

## Compile-time variant functions

- **MTLFunctionConstantValues**: A set of constant values that specialize a graphics or compute GPU function.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
